definitions.definition: the crime of stealing money or goods from a bank, shop, person, etc., especially using violence or threats
definitions.labels: (British English)(North American English)(British English)(North American English)(especially British English)(especially British English)(especially North American English)(especially British English)

examples.text: **armed robbery** *(= using a gun, knife, etc.)*
There has been a spate of robberies in the area recently.
He was shot as he tried to foil a **bank robbery**.
He already had a conviction for armed robbery.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French and Old French roberie, from the verb rober, of Germanic origin.
